children.subject:
All classes will update their instruction format on classes.berkeley.edu by mid July. If its said hybrid instead of remote, then probably there would be some limited in-person lectures before thanksgiving.

Maybe classes would let TAs make their own decision about holding discussion in-person. So there could be  a few in-person discussions without in-person lectures.

history.content:
I understand that all classes will give students the option to attend classes fully online, but will classes like CS61c or CS170 offer some sort of in-person component? (Maybe like live discussions or live labs, but restricted lectures)

Additionally have any professors in the CS department laid out their plans for how classes will be conducted in the Fall as of yet, or is it still too early to tell?

Thanks for any help or comments :-)
history.subject: Will 61c or 170 have an in-person component?
